phase.name: Homepage, Featured Exhibition, and Polish
phase.goal: Provide a public homepage with a featured exhibition and refine the UI/UX for initial real-world testing.

in.item: Basic UX polish (loading states, error messages)
Optional: info text about curator access (e.g. "To curate exhibitions, register with your @hsbi.de email")

out.item: No full CMS for news or blog content

backend.item: Add a way to mark one published ExhibitionVersion as "featured" (e.g. a field or a settings table).
Expose an endpoint to fetch featured exhibition and a list of past published exhibitions.

frontend.item: Implement homepage "/" showing featured exhibition info and link to /exhibition/:slug.
Show a list of past exhibitions with links to their viewer routes.
Add loading indicators for heavy operations (model loading, video processing status) and user-friendly error feedback.
Optionally add a footer or info section mentioning that curator access requires an @hsbi.de email address.

successCriteria.item: Opening "/" shows a curated entry point into CuraHub with at least one featured exhibition.
Visitors understand the platform is open for viewing but restricted for curators to @hsbi.de accounts.
The system feels coherent and ready for tests with real curators and visitors.
